Instruction: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees Fahrenheit (165 degrees Celsius) and grease a 2-quart baking dish.
Boil water, rice, and salt in a saucepan. Lower heat, cover, and simmer until rice is tender and liquid is mostly absorbed, about 20 to 25 minutes.

Cook the bacon in a large, deep skillet over medium-high heat until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Retain about 1 tablespoon of bacon drippings in the pan. Once done, drain the bacon on a paper towel-lined plate and let it cool slightly. Crumble the bacon once cooled enough to handle.

Saute onions in the bacon drippings until they turn translucent. Add crumbled bacon, tomato sauce, tomato paste, sugar, Worcestershire sauce, and hot sauce. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce heat and let it simmer for 10 minutes.
Combine cooked rice with the tomato-bacon mixture in the prepared baking dish, ensuring it is well mixed.
Bake, covered, in the preheated oven for 45 minutes.
